trans-unit.source: Represents an attribute that is associated with the subject of a <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttributeStatement"></xref>.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute> class corresponds to the `<saml:Attribute>` XML element that is defined in the OASIS SAML 1.1 specification.

A <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute> instance contains <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.Rights.PossessProperty%2A> claims for the subject of a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttributeStatement>.

For example, a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute> might contain an `Over21` claim, whose type would be specified in the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute.Namespace%2A> property and whose resource would be specified as a member of the collection in the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute.AttributeValues%2A> property.

When the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlStatement.CreatePolicy%2A> method is called, this `Over21` claim is added to the authorization policy that is returned by returned from by the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttributeStatement>.
When the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute.AttributeValues%2A> property contains multiple elements then one claim is returned for each element.
<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute> position in the SAML object hierarchy is:
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute"></xref> class using the specified claim.
Use this constructor to convert a claim into a SAML attribute.

To be converted to a SAML attribute, the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim.Right%2A> property must be <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.Rights.PossessProperty%2A>, the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim.Resource%2A> property must be of type <xref:System.String>, and the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim.ClaimType%2A> property must be in the format `namespace/name`.

The following table specifies what the `claim` parameter sets the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute.Name%2A>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute.Namespace%2A>, and the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute.AttributeValues%2A> properties to.
Property
Property of the `claim` parameter used to set the property
The value of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim.Resource%2A> property is added to the collection.
The portion of the string after the last '/' character in the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim.ClaimType%2A> property.
The portion of the string before the last '/' character in the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim.ClaimType%2A> property.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim"></xref> that represents an attribute of the subject for a <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken"></xref> security token.
claim is `null`.
The property of claim is not of type .
-or-
The property of claim is not .
-or-
The property of claim does not have a '/' character or it is in the first or last index positions.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute"></xref> class using the specified attribute name, XML namespace, and attribute values.
The following table specifies the properties that are set by this constructor's parameters.
Property
Parameter
The XML namespace in which the attributeName parameter is defined.
The name of the SAML attribute.
An <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1"></xref> that contains the values of the SAML attribute.
attributeNamespace is `null`.
-or-
attributeName is `null`.
-or-
attributeValues is `null`.
The property of claim is not of type .
-or-
The property of claim is not .
-or-
The property of claim does not have a '/' character or it is in the first or last index positions.
Gets a collection of attribute values for the SAML attribute.
A SAML attribute may contain more than one attribute value.

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute.AttributeValues%2A> property corresponds to the `<saml:AttributeValue>` element that is defined in the Assertions and Protocol for the OASIS Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) specification.
A <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IList`1"></xref> that contains the set of attribute values for the SAML attribute.
Gets or sets the xsi:type of the values contained in the SAML Attribute.

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute.AttributeValueXsiType%2A> property corresponds to the `type` attribute of the `<saml:AttributeValue>` element that is defined in the Assertions and Protocol for the OASIS Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) specification.
This attribute is required.
A string that contains the xsi:type.
The default is <xref href="System.Security.Claims.ClaimValueTypes.String"></xref>.
An attempt to set a value that is `null` or empty occurs.
-or-
An attempt to set a value that is malformed occurs.
Gets a collection of claims that this SAML attribute represents.
<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security tokens specify their claims using SAML assertions that can specify an attribute about the subject represented by the security token.
Use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute.ExtractClaims%2A> method to convert the SAML attribute into a set of claims.

A <xref href="System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection`1"></xref> of type <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim"></xref> that contains the set of claims that this SAML attribute represents.
Gets a value that indicates whether the properties of this instance are read-only.
To make this instance of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute> class read-only, call the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute.MakeReadOnly%2A> method.
`true` if the properties of this instance are read-only; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Causes this instance to be read-only.

When the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute.MakeReadOnly%2A> method is called, the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute.IsReadOnly%2A> property is set to `true` and properties of this instance can no longer be set.
Gets or sets the name of the SAML attribute.
To specify the values associated with this SAML attribute, set the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute.AttributeValues%2A> property

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute.Name%2A> property corresponds to the `AttributeName` attribute of the `<Attribute>` element that is defined in the Assertions and Protocol for the OASIS Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) specification.
The name of the SAML attribute.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute.Name"></xref> property is set and the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute.IsReadOnly"></xref> property is `true`.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute.Name"></xref> property is set to `null`.
Gets or sets the XML namespace in which the name of the SAML attribute is defined.
To set the name of the SAML attribute, set the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute.Name%2A> property.

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute.Namespace%2A> property corresponds to the `AttributeNamespace` attribute of the `<AttributeDesignator>` element that is defined in the Assertions and Protocol for the OASIS Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) specification.
The XML namespace in which the name of the SAML attribute is defined.
Gets or sets the string that represents the OriginalIssuer of the SAML attribute.
The original issuer of the SAML attribute.
An attempt to set a value that is an empty string occurs.
Reads the SAML attribute from the specified XML reader.

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute.ReadXml%28System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader%2CSystem.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer%2CSystem.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenSerializer%2CSystem.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenResolver%29> method sets the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute.AttributeValues%2A>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute.Name%2A>, and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute.Namespace%2A> properties.
A <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader"></xref> to read the SAML attribute.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer"></xref> that is capable of reading XML elements in the SAML specification.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenResolver"></xref> that determines the security token that created the digital signature.
reader is `null`.
-or-
samlSerializer is `null`.
reader refers to an XML element that does not have the `AttributeName` and `AttributeNamespace` attributes.
Writes the SAML attribute into the specified XML serializer.
A <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter"></xref> to write the SAML attribute.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer"></xref> that is capable of writing XML elements in a SAML assertion.
writer is `null`.
-or-
samlSerializer is `null`.
